page.title: 05TRANSPORT
page.content: Transport is a national problem in rural areas.Aston villagers rely on private cars and coaches.Coach services run Banbury to Woodford via Byfield 4 times every day except Sunday.On Market days,coaches run from Boddington via Aston to Banbury twice a.m. and p.m. Private parties also hire coaches e.g. School Football/Netball teams,old peoples outings. {TRAVEL TO WORK}. People travel to work in Appletree, Chiping Warden, Byfield, Woodford Halse, Cropredy, Claydon, Edgcote, and also to Daventry, Leamington Spa, Coventry, Towcester, Northampton. A USAF airman works at Upper Heyford base. An airline pilot flies from Luton Airport. One man drives to his job in Greenford, Middx, daily.
